title: Installation of Valgrind +MPI with Intel Using Auto Dispatch Variant
body:
This is probably targeted for @glennpj or others with better awareness of `-ax<vectorization>` for auto dispatch.

Is there a way to disable `-ax<option>` while building tools like Valgrind, after setting building Intel compilers with `auto_dispatch=COMMON_AVX512`?

My workaround is to remove the added lines to the matching `{icpc,icc,ifort}.cfg` files.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

An example spec looks something like this where I really have `intel` in place of `intel-parallel-studio`

```
valgrind@3.15.0 %intel@18.0.5 ^mvapich2@2.3.1
```

This is consistent across Intel 18 and 19 latest compilers, where in my case I had `-axCOMMON-AVX512` appended to the aforementioned `cfg` files.

### Error Message

```
  >> 5870    /usr/local/pace-apps/temp/spack/var/0.12/stage/kmanalo3/spack-stag
             e/spack-stage-fBlVLy/spack-src/coregrind/m_wordfm.c:706: undefined
              reference to `__intel_cpu_feature_indicator'
  >> 5871    /usr/local/pace-apps/temp/spack/var/0.12/stage/kmanalo3/spack-stag
             e/spack-stage-fBlVLy/spack-src/coregrind/m_wordfm.c:706: undefined
              reference to `__intel_cpu_feature_indicator'
  >> 5872    /usr/local/pace-apps/temp/spack/var/0.12/stage/kmanalo3/spack-stag
             e/spack-stage-fBlVLy/spack-src/coregrind/m_wordfm.c:706: undefined
              reference to `__intel_cpu_features_init'
```

These are typical errors.

### Information on your system

`linux_x86_64`
Cascade Lake systems
RHEL7.6
